title: wowowowowowow
comment: loved it.

title: Yes it's vim but needs some improvements
comment: Since Android 5.0, I've noticed the overlaying app could use some changes. The only thing I'd like is options to change what commands are above the touch keyboard. Thats all. The only other improvement would be providing a default plugin manager, like Vundle.

title: I love you for this app.
comment: My favourite application on the go. It works just like I'd expect it to.  However, I need to be able to manually set ˜ (aka $HOME) to /sdcard. Otherwise, I cannot edit my .vimrc.

title: Root mode crashes
comment: It's another phone, and another rom, and still the same bug. This app simply won't work as root.

title: Just started testing it
comment: So far it's amazing. It works. I find it challenging because I'm used to using my fingers and the keystrokes are all memorized. It far exceeds the other Android text editors that I've used. It's nice that it is a recognized editor when you open up a text file. Thank you so much.

title: Unable to edit opened existing file
comment: Pressed Esc+i also not editing. How to type text in this vi? (FYI: I am using vi/vim/gvim in Linux,Solaris for past 12 years, not beginner to vi)

title: Nice touch port but ...
comment: Vim was designed to be used with terminals and emulators. It's nice to see an Android experience of it' but really I was just looking for a vim bin that was compatible with the android environment. Basically, this is cute but there are 1000s of better editors for Android devices. I was just looking for one to use in terminal sessions. Not an independent emulation of the experience. I have no idea what use this would be for other than to say "neato".
great touchscreen vim!
Awesome

title: Stagnant
comment: Cannot change the home directory so its sticks.  Cannot edit vimrc.  CanNOT create a macro to help these maladies with a kludge, even.  What can be gained from being hobbled like this?  Can someone _please_ convince me I'm wrong about it?  Does it require a rooted device.

title: Yeppie
comment: Dream come true. Once vi comes into a platform, it is game over time for all other text editors. I know android already had a vi in its shell, but the lack of physical keyboard made it unusable. Btw why doesn't this show up when searching for text editor?

title: One step backword, keep trying
comment: I'm unable to open files from within VIM in the latest ver (I have a Sony Xperia Z3 flagship phone). I have to use a file browser instead. Ver 2.6r2 not only allows me to open files from within VIM, it also allows me to do vert diff split (thank you so much for that).  Sadly, I get an error message when doing that diffsplit "E97: Cannot create diffs". I need to use VIM base ver 7.4.399 or higher so I can use blowfish 2 encryption since blowfish 1 has a security flaw. This uses 7.3. Great effort though.
Thanks for feedback and the "vert diffsplit" was introduced in v2.5r2 . Happy hacking!

title: Broken now
comment: Used to be great. Can't open vimrc anymore.

title: Finally root on x86 but FC (r1 too)
comment: Thanks for the update. Edit: FC after v2.7 update if root is enabled in preferences. v2.7r1 doesn't fix the FC. Worse, not only on x86 (4.3, SuperSU v2.46) but also on my older ARM device (4.1.2, SuperSU v2.02). So now I'm using older v2.6 on ARM with root, and this on x86 without root. Please do something :(
Excellent, if you know VI editor. Gets around the lack of cursor keys.

title: Life has never been the same after installing this
comment: My god what a game changer! Word of warning: I noticed some .vimrc file edit problems on lollipop, but my KitKat devices are very happy with this app! Thanks so much, developers. You changed how I perceive Android.

title: where are my saved files??

title: Best text editor ever
comment: > hurr durr, buggy, waste of time: it is a free application, and the source is opened. Why don't _you_ fix the bug instead of waiting for the uploader's fix?

title: Crap
comment: Does not even deserve a star.

title: Needs Work!!
comment: Since I use gVim every day at work and home, I was glad to see this for Android, so I installed it.  Then my phone kept rebooting.  I'm an IT Architect, so I knew what to do.  It took me a while -- a couple of weeks, of uninstalling a couple of other apps along with this one (the apps I had installed just before the phone started rebooting), then re-installing them (over days!) and then uninstalling, and so on.  As I say, that took many days, since I would have to wait for a couple of days to see if the phone would reboot or not .I finally was able to conclusively prove that it was only after I installed Vim Touch that the phone kept rebooting.  I have now had it uninstalled for a couple of weeks, I've reinstalled the other apps, and my phone is not rebooting.  Since it does not run all the time in the background, all I can figure is that there is something that is going haywire during the install itself, causing problems later on.  File corruption?  Something not being registered right?  I haven't done any Android development, just UNIX and Linux (since 1980!), so I don't know what to tell you.  Fix that issue and you've got 5 stars from me.

title: Learning VIM
comment: I am learning VIM and so far really like it, but when I turn on "Set user as root" it crashers.  I am rooted and am running SuperSU on a Galaxy S3.
It's good.

title: Epic Text Editor

title: wait for next version

I can not type anything,  neither can run any commands like h j k l or yy or p or x etc.. this happens when trying to edit file opened using left slider file browser. If I just start writing new file the above commands and typing works fine.

title: What the Internet is supposed to be.
comment: This implementation of vim is excellent and is a very generous effort by the developer. When I reported an issue with a fresh release it was fixed within hours. I have only praise for this effort.

title: Nice  adaptation.
comment: It needs a little work in making the defaults a bit more touch friendly, but it's very usable as is. Those complaining of crashes should file bug reports.  I haven't seen any so far on my GS5.

title: Buggy, horrible, time-waisting
comment: For example: fullscreen, indenting and commandline zooming don't work properly. What a waist of my time. One star is to much. This is not an finished app. Why did you made it online

title: Doesn't work on Nexus 10 with Android 5.0.1

title: used to be perfect
comment: crashes make the current version unusable. If this gets fixed it's back to 5 stars for me

title: Can't understand the 5 stars
comment: It doesn't seem able to manage its own internal files. Several times I had to go into /data deleting swapfiles of Vim Touch's config files.  It doesn't seem to have any resilience to its own preference settings. Even if your phone is rooted, don't set Vim Touch's Root option! It will never start again so you can't switch the option off. Other pref settings and normal vim uses also do this. And oh wow: *don't* try using vim encryption. Hangs and force quits everywhere. Then it made 3 of my files become zero size.  All my 40+ others apps are working fine. I can't understand the 5 stars for Vim Touch. Perhaps people are just enjoying it as a toy or a novelty. But if you try to do anything half-serious with it it will break and take some of your files with it.                    (HTC one rooted with very stable CM10 and no problems in other apps)
Not opening on 5.0

title: Full Circle
comment: Though Vim (or vi) has been my favorite text editor for nearly 20 years, I completely get that biggest hurdle for most people is the "mode oriented" editing environment.  Ironically, it's this very modal nature that makes it so usable on a small form-factor device like a phone without having to sacrifice any of its editing power.  (Of course, having a keyboard like the "hackers keyboard" with real TAB, ESC, and arrow keys makes life much easier, but even that's not absolutely essential in this port.)

title: Not working in Android Lollipop
comment: Worked fine in Android 4.3, but not working in Android 5.0; closes as soon as it opens.
Doesn't start on lollipop
Edit on your phone almost as well as on Linux. Slider is useful.

title: Appreciate the effort.
comment: I appreciate the effort the developers put into this, but the crashing makes it unusable. It crashed within 5 seconds of my first time opening this app. Thereafter, at random. I really want a stable VIM to use on my tablet, but without reliability, this is useless. I am going to dual boot Linux to allow me to use VIM, but I will keep an eye on this app in hopes that the quality improves.

title: Crashes hard
comment: Less then 2 mins of ownership and crashed twice.

title: Too unstable
comment: I love vim and I love the effort made to duplicate many of vim ' s features including folds and plugin support.  But crashing when swiping to move about a file, is particularly annoying.  I have tried creating lots of navigational shortcuts on the toolbar just so my fingers don't have to touch the screen text input area.  Also keep as few as apps open as possible.  Still crashes.  I purchased another editor to get the stability needed when editing my python files.

title: Just what I need
comment: A plain simple trusty editor

title: Works best with a bluetooth keyboard
comment: Editing with just the on-screen keyboard is a disaster, but with a bluetooth keyboard the input becomes very acceptable, good enough for seriously writing text in the editor I love. Two issues, not necessarily for the app itself, which in my case works quite smoothly without crashes:  - I had trouble locating the Esc key on the keyboard, such a very important key in vim, but this is a problem of the keyboard itself. I have to use a silly combination of function and control keys to get it. - Now that I have edited and saved a file, how do I send it and use it elsewhere??? I would appreciate an upload or send feature,  as in the Photo Gallery. Now I have to hunt down the files with a file manager or do it with a console. This should be easier!

title: Good concept but too unstable
comment: A crashing editor is something unacceptable. Unfortunately, Vim Touch crashes quite often, with data loss as consequence. Nevertheless, the app looks very promising... 5 stars it was stable!

title: Really wanted give 5 stars

title: Wow!!  Real VIM on my phone!!
comment: I love VIm and even having barely scratched the surface of its capabilities I still miss it when using other editors.  This version works amazingly well on my phone with only a 4" screen.  But as happy as I am with having such a powerful version of VIM on my phone I'm only giving it 4 stars because it has crashed several times in a short period of time.  I don't foresee doing much editing on my phone so I'm not so concerned about losing work if it crashes, but can't give it 5 stars. I'm mostly interested in it for its searching capabilities with a large 1MB text file. I'm running v2.6 on Android 4.0

title: Excellent app - Vim on Android!
comment: The app crashes at times, but I can tolerate since this is Vim!  If you are a Vim user, use this app and get the full runtime.  If you are not a Vim user, even better to start using Vim.  Vim is available for Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android - no more using several editors.  Once you get used to using just the keyboard to edit files, your productivity will skyrocket!  Vim is very powerful and underrated.  There is not a better editor anywhere!

title: touch no longer sucks for input

title: Wow!
comment: I use vim everyday at work and I love having it on Android!  Great job!

title: terrific implementation
comment: I use vim on a daily basis on Linux and Windows and was unsure about how a touch version would work. Answer is :L brilliantly. On my Galaxy Note phablet there is enough space for the virtual keyboard to see a reasonable amount of text file and the one-touch key combinations that are available make it very easy to use (if you have some familiarity with standard vim). This is the only text editor I will need on the phone from now on. I have already uninstalled a couple of others.

title: One of the best apps
comment: Being aneveryday Vim user (I'm typing this in Vim :)), I simply want to be able to use Vim on every device I use for more than 5 minutes. I come from a Nokia N900 device, running Maemo (which is running on a real Linux stack based on Debian) and when I switched to Android I feared I would have to miss my beloved editor. Vimtouch is really awesome, certainly now that it has 256 color support. For me it is one of the most useful Android apps which makes the switch to Android a rather smooth one!

title: EXCEPTIONAL!
comment: Learning vim can be tedious but I assure you it pays off in the end.

title: Impressed
comment: This editor is perfect with a keyboard. I can write up programs and notes very quickly on my tablet. I was impressed by the similarity between VIM on my desktop and on my android device.

title: Excellent editor!
comment: For those with "can't open file for write", go to options, edit vimrc, and add at the top:  :cd /sdcard  Save and enjoy!  That being said, this is exactly what you'd expect: vim, fully-featured. It supports colorschemes, plugins, etc. etc, just like the real thing. Finally I have a good editor to complement the C compiler!  [hint: by default, the back button sends ESC]

title: Cannot save or open files
comment: Very good interface and general feel, however I was completely unable to save my file. The app simply told me "unable to open file for write" etc. Pity because otherwise this is the best android text editor I have seen

title: expandtabs
comment: In response to a comment from another review: set noexpandtabs  in vimrc  "A Google User - November 8, 2012 - Samsung Galaxy Nexus with version 1.7 Uses spaces when a tab is inserted Upon typing a tab character, this does not adhere to default vim behaviour, and inserts four spaces. Death to spaces."  Great app. Opens large files easily. 1.4mb is what I currently use it on. Also vimencrypted files works the same.

title: Chinese
comment: Very great job! But I can't input Chinese simplified by using Google Pinyin.

title: I love you
comment: This is perfect. Perfect I tell you!
Perfect

title: A+
comment: Surprisingly convenient implementation -- usable even on a phone!
Awesome!

title: Uses spaces when a tab is inserted
comment: Upon typing a tab character, this does not adhere to default vim  behaviour, and inserts four spaces. Death to spaces.

title: Very promising
comment: With some more work on stability and off loading some of the files to external storage this app could become my most favorite.  Don't forget to add a pay version one day.  You deserve it.

title: Poor hardware keyboard support.
comment: Does not support the SYM key as found on the Droid 4 and a few others.

Sweet GUI for the best editor around

title: Perfect
comment: Works exactly like it should. It's the real vim runtime, so my fancy vimrc works. On a tablet with a keyboard (ASUS Transformer Prime), it's just like being on a computer.

title: Great!
comment: A real editor for android :-)

title: Swype
comment: Insert mode doesn't work correctly with Swype. Great implementation otherwise.

title: VI > emacs
comment: Now this is one other greatest editor forever! Vi FTW!!!

title: The famous Vim on Android
comment: Needs polish but it works good and the concept of bringing Vim to Android is great as embedded Linux makes its way onto arm touch devices there will be more and more use for this. I also have no doubt as the developer works on this app it will eventually be as sweet as the original.

title: Good, fast but...
comment: It's hung when i paste a big text (~200 lines)

title: Very well done
comment: No doubt it's tough to make vim usable in a touch environment but this works nicely.  Using hackers keyboard is probably best.

title: Terrific work!
comment: I am speechless. This is real quality work with attention to detail. Vim touch is perfect for my Galaxy Note. Thank you

title: Crashes on galaxy nexus
comment: The old version worked perfectly on the machines, but when updated, it keeps crashing. Please fix the bugs, Thx!

title: Amazing app!
comment: Very cool to be able to use vim on android. The Nexus 7 has plenty of screen real estate to make this app really useful for editing and viewing text files.

title: VIM yeah!
comment: just like VIM on other platform.

title: Finally work on Cyanogen Mod 7.1!
comment: Platform is Nook Color. Latest update runs.

title: Great app!
comment: After last few updates it works great!

title: HTC Vivid
comment: I love vim, but this needs a little work. For one, if you background the app, when you bring it back up android doesn't recognize that it needs a keyboard so you can't type anymore. In android 4 apparently you can no longer bring up the keyboard by long pressing menu, either.

title: Unbefreakinglievable
comment: I've had this only a few days, but so far, it seems to be exactly what I was waiting for.  It's not a trivial task to make Vim usable without a real physical keyboard, but this app has done it.  Kudos!

title: Remarkable
comment: The developer has done an excellent job - VimTouch works really fine - and he is very responsive.  Vim + touch + voice dictation (it works inside VimTouch !) = bliss  NB : I have a Galaxy Nexus with JB

title: Hehe.
comment: Excellent job!

title: Good
comment: Good work

title: Abysmal
comment: It's humongous! You want to install it, it says 3.2M, but then you run it for the first time and a screen warns you that (another?) installation is gonna take a few minutes... which it really does. The next thing I know, the device halts everything and forces me to free up memory somehow before it will let me do anything, because almost all of it is gone! Turns out the 3.2M has expanded into 15M! Then I manage to make the program run, but it's slow, awkward, and Auto Text won't work in it... Sigh. I love Vim, but now I really have no idea how this monster can be useful in a phone. A phone is a phone, not a desktop. What was I thinking? Well, good luck to those who will give it a try anyway.

title: Excellent port
comment: Thank you so much for this port! Keep up the great work :)

title: Promising
comment: This looks great on my tf301+dock. Not sure yet if it allows vim plug ins on ~/.vim if it does I will up to 4 stars
Cool program, but the new icon is an eyesore
Good

title: Awesome
comment: Thanks for the new release.

title: Great app
comment: On Xperia Mini Pro with hardware keyboard this app works great. My only issue is that it takes up a lot internal space and cannot be moved to the sd-card

title: Use External Storage Plz
comment: My Nexus-One has too small internal storage, so I beg you to develop Vim-Touch to be able to use External Storage for RTPs

title: nice but soft keyboard buggy
comment: After toggling soft keyboard on, it remained on even after exiting the app. Also, app seems to crash if returned to via task manager. Also, I'm using 'Hacker Keyboard', which has a convenient, working ESC key. It is not recognised by this app.
Back key mapped to escape : trully functionnal vim on transformer prime !	Thanks for making it happening. I finally have a decent text editor on transformer prime !
Interestin

title: Samsung S3
comment: Will not start properly.. hangs up and crashes... not usable at all :(

title: Awesome! Found vimrc!
comment: Awesome app if you're using a hard keyboard. Why would you want vim if you weren't? Vimrc is located at /data/data/net.momodalo.app.vimtouch/files/vim for all those with rooted phones who were wondering!

title: Vim without hassle
comment: This is way easier than trying to use vim through connectbot. (after figuring out how to do a proper crosscompile)  Any chance of adding the help files?

title: Gotta love it Vi
comment: As an old Unix dog I want vi everywhere, on my phone, on my Nexus 7, and even on Win***.  Any app that is free and only needs permission for my SDcard gets 5 stars off the top.  I haven't played with it much yet, but it has worked great thus far.

title: Need to remap escape key
comment: Really like the layout, except on an Asus Transformer I would like to be able to remap the escape (and control) keys to the keys on my keyboard dock -- barring this issue, I'm pretty happy with it.

title: Amazing. Unbelievably Amazing!
comment: Thank you thank you thank you for porting this!!!! I would of never even thought to look for this..   Until today, I just thought to myself, I wonder if there is Vim for Android? so sure enough this awesome developer made this possible for us!!   Thank you so very much! I love it!   But yeah, as the top comment mentions, it is best to use an external keyboard. But still usable with the software keyboard as well.   Thank you!!

title: Perfect
comment: I just wish I could use vim shortcuts/ command mode with every text field I encounter on ny phone.

title: Great port
comment: Tnx

title: Delivers VIM for Android
comment: Works nicely on an Asus Transformer Prime (with physical keyboard). Has everything I need and expect from VIM. Nice work, well done.

title: My fave editor
comment: Take addiction to the next level baby
Incredible

title: Good effort. Doesn't work with bluetooth keyboard.
comment: I used to use Terminal IDE for its VIM, and was eagerly waiting for a native VIM app. Many thanks to the developers for their effort on this app. As it is VIM, users shouldn't expect to use it well with a soft keyboard. However, I found that even when using my hardware bluetooth keyboard (Sony Tablet S, Sony bluetooth keyboard), there are some problems.  1. The ctrl key does not work. More specifically when I'm using ctrl-d and ctrl-u to scroll down and up (by a half-page) respectively. The app doesn't seem to be aware that the ctrl key was pressed.  2. What I like about the VIM in Terminal IDE is that there is an toggle option to set the Android "back" key as the esc key. This app (by default, as of 26 April 2012) uses "tap screen" as the esc key. I wish I could configure it so that the Android "back" key were the esc key.  3. There is no obvious way to configure vimrc. I wish this were included in the options.  If all these problems above, or even just the first two, were addressed, then this app would definitely be 5 stars. Hell I would even pay a reasonable amount for it.

title: Soft keyboards need not apply
comment: This vim implementation deserves four stars for its author's effort, if for no other reason.  This app is what you're looking for when you have a phone with a hardware keyboard. Or perhaps you use a bluetooth keyboard, as I sometimes do. In these cases the app works as you'd expect.  Most phones use a soft keyboard nowadays. This is where "Vi IMproved Touch" falls short. The app doesn't compensate for the presence of the soft keyboard. You end up hiding and showing the keyboard constantly. Not usable.

title: White screen when u switch apps
comment: Wonderful to have a nearly complete VIM running on an unrooted tablet. A couple of suggestions:  1) please default the write path to /mnt/usb_storage when a usb stick is inserted 2) -2* because I get an unresponsive, white screen when I return to your vim window from any other app. This makes your vim basically useless to me, since I have to power off tablet to clear vim out of the running program stack.  I'll eventually root, see if that fixes 2)

title: A great editor
comment: A wonderful port of my favorite editor of over 20 years. A very pleasant surprise that it let me drop into a shell. It puts real power in my pocket. :)

title: Happy
comment: Great to have the power of vi on my Asus Transformer.  Would like it if had settings for tablets with external keyboards like allow back button to double as esc, or be able to toggle the display of vi commands at top since it is already at bottom.

title: At long last
comment: There are certainly some improvements that could be made, but overall I'm just so freaking happy someone has brought Vim to the touch screen! Thanks, and keep up the great work.

title: Good
comment: The only issue I have is needing to to tap the screen for escape. If button mapping could be changed for esc then it would be much more usable.

title: Great, but
comment: 5 stars you add an option to map capslock to escape:)

title: good vim port
comment: I'm very satisfied by this vim port. It will be even better when "back" will be mapped on "esc" and if ctrl wasn't mapped to 'p' (although I suspect that it may be a bug and not really intentional).  Anyway, great job.It's my favorite editor on transformer !!

title: Vim!
comment: <3 Yay!

title: Wow!
comment: Modal editing works wonderfully with a touch UI! Thanks!

title: Love this app!
comment: At first look this app is amazing! All the features seem to be there with the native runtime.

title: Vim!
comment: Great just what I have been looking for since getting Android works as expected.Thanks

title: Works now!
comment: Version 1.1 works fine! But it seems the version here is 1.0 which hangs while installing. Make sure to get the latest from the website, until this is fixed here. :)
